intro: Carapa batesii, commonly known as wild copaiba, is a tropical tree native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and yellowish or greenish flowers. The tree produces a valuable resin, often used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils. Its bark and seeds are also utilized in various applications, including cosmetics and pharmaceuticals. Carapa batesii plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, contributing to biodiversity and soil stability.
